alert.note: Alert for Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth (Massachusetts) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 23 at 6:40PM EDT by NWS Boston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southern Norfolk, southeastern Worcester, northwestern Plymouth, northwestern Bristol and northeastern Providence Counties through 745 PM EDT... At 639 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Cumberland, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Strong winds could cause minor damage such as downed branches. Little to no impact from hail is expected. Locations impacted include... Brockton, Pawtucket, Taunton, Weymouth, Woonsocket, Cumberland, Randolph, North Providence, Franklin, North Attleborough, Milford, Stoughton, Bridgewater, Attleboro, Walpole, Mansfield, Middleborough, Easton, Canton and Smithfield. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: Get indoors when you hear thunder. Do not resume outdoor activities until at least 30 minutes after the storm has passed. Do not drive through flooded roads or underpasses. Avoid low lying areas near small streams. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. For your safety, go indoors or to your vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Norfolk; Eastern Plymouth; Northern Bristol; Southern Worcester; Western Norfolk; Western Plymouth
